page.title: 12INLAND WATER
page.content: Ross town has 3 man-made ponds-at Merrivale & the Chase-a borehole & a reservoir - at Alton Court Waterworks. Weston has 4 ponds & a moat - at Boll- itree & Lower Weston. All the ponds are visited by Mallard ducks, only the Chase has one swan. Fritallary, a pro- tected rare flower recorded on the edge of Merrivale pond. The AltonCourt waterworks supplies Ross by a new elec tric pump with a capacity of 21000 gal lons per hr.A 5"pipe leads from reser- voir to the works & another 5" pipe supplies the town; original borehole sunk in l886 12' deep.Evidence of carp eels & goldfish at all ponds except Lower Weston,here only eels. Merrivale pond fed by spring, leading undergr- ound to Chase, then to Rudhall. Lower Weston spring fed, then also leads underground to Rudhall, then to Wye.
